semantic_title: Impending or Threatened Conditions POA Assignment
section_path: Present on Admission Guidelines > Assigning the POA Indicator > Conditions documented as impending or threatened at the time of discharge

content.full_text: If the final diagnosis contains an impending or threatened diagnosis, and this diagnosis is based on symptoms or clinical findings that were present on admission, assign 'Y'. If the final diagnosis contains an impending or threatened diagnosis, and this diagnosis is based on symptoms or clinical findings that were not present on admission, assign 'N'. (Evidence: pg no: 119, L45-L47)
content.summary: For impending or threatened diagnoses, assign Y if based on admission findings, N if based on post-admission findings (Evidence: pg no: 119, L45-L47)
key_concepts: Based on admission symptoms (Evidence: pg no: 119, L46)
Based on post-admission symptoms (Evidence: pg no: 119, L47)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign Y for impending/threatened diagnoses based on admission findings (Evidence: pg no: 119, L46)
detailed_rules.explanation: When final diagnosis is impending or threatened and is based on symptoms or clinical findings present at admission, assign Y (Evidence: pg no: 119, L45-L46)
common_applications: Impending respiratory failure based on admission dyspnea
Threatened abortion based on admission bleeding

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign N for impending/threatened diagnoses based on post-admission findings (Evidence: pg no: 119, L47)
detailed_rules.explanation: When final diagnosis is impending or threatened and is based on symptoms or clinical findings not present at admission, assign N (Evidence: pg no: 119, L47)
common_applications: Impending complications based on post-admission symptoms
Threatened conditions based on hospital-acquired findings

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify impending or threatened diagnosis
Step 2: Determine what symptoms/findings support the diagnosis
Step 3: Check if symptoms/findings were present at admission
Step 4: Assign Y if present at admission, N if not

coding_scenarios.scenario: Impending respiratory failure based on admission dyspnea
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Admission: Severe dyspnea. Discharge: Impending respiratory failure based on admission respiratory distress
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify impending respiratory failure diagnosis
Step 2: Note it's based on admission dyspnea
Step 3: Assign Y because based on admission symptoms

correct_coding.primary_code: Impending respiratory failure with Y indicator
correct_coding.rationale: Impending diagnosis based on admission symptoms (Evidence: pg no: 119, L45-L46)

incorrect_coding.code: Impending respiratory failure with N indicator
incorrect_coding.rationale: Should assign Y when based on admission symptoms
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Not considering what symptoms support the impending diagnosis

warnings: Must determine what symptoms/findings support the impending/threatened diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 119, L45-L47)
best_practices: Review what clinical evidence supports the impending/threatened diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 119, L45-L47)
common_mistakes: Not considering the basis for impending/threatened diagnoses (Evidence: pg no: 119, L45-L47)
tips: Look for connection between diagnosis and supporting symptoms (Evidence: pg no: 119, L45-L47)
implementation_notes: Train coders to identify basis for impending/threatened diagnoses
clinical_context: Providers may document conditions as impending or threatened
